Package seng202.group5.gui

Class OrderController

  • java.lang.Object
    • seng202.group5.gui.GeneralController
      • seng202.group5.gui.OrderController
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AddPastOrderController
    public class OrderController
extends GeneralController
    This controller handles all the functionality with the making a new order or editing an existing order.

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addExtraIngredientScreen​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Changes screen to the add ingredient screen to select ingredients to add to the recipe by passing in the item.
      void addItemToOrder​(MenuItem item)
      This method adds the selected menu Item to the stock only if the valid amount of ingredients are available.
      void currentOrderTable()
      This function populates the mini invoice screen with the selected menu items along with their quantity which are the part of the current order
      void filterItems()
      Filters the menu items in the menu based on the check boxes on the order screen
      protected MenuItem getSelectedItem()
      A method to get the selected item for the alternate order screen in history
      void populateIngredientsTable()
      This method shows the amount of ingredients in a selected menu item
      void populateTilePane​(java.util.Collection<MenuItem> items)
      Adds all the menu items in the menu to the tile pane
      void pseudoInitialize()
      A function which can be overwritten to initialize a controller with the AppEnvironment set, which is not available with the regular initialize method
      protected void setCurrentOrder​(Order order)
      A method to set the current order for the alternate order screen in history
      void setMenuItem​(MenuItem newItem)
      Updates the display with items using the selected item.
      void sortItems​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This function sorts the menu item by its price

        public void setMenuItem​(MenuItem newItem)
        Updates the display with items using the selected item.
        Parameters:
        newItem - the new item with updated quantities and categories.

      • addItemToOrder

        public void addItemToOrder​(MenuItem item)
        This method adds the selected menu Item to the stock only if the valid amount of ingredients are available. Otherwise displays the appropriate message if the order can/cannot be added. Calls setMenuItem() if adding the item is successful.

      • populateIngredientsTable

        public void populateIngredientsTable()
        This method shows the amount of ingredients in a selected menu item
